name: 1-aminonaphthalene
source: Aldrich Chemical Company; Aldrich Catalog-Handbook of Fine Chemicals; Milwaukee; WI; 1984.

name: 1-aminonaphthalene
source: Aldrich Chemical Company; Aldrich Catalog-Handbook of Fine Chemicals; Milwaukee; WI; 1984.
Reason: The compound 1-aminonaphthalene contains a naphthalene base and an amino (-NH2) group. The basic unit, naphthalene has a melting point of 80.7°C. The amino group typically decreases the melting point due to its capability to donate a hydrogen bond, reducing intermolecular attractive forces when compared to the pure hydrocarbon. We can approximate this reduction to be around -32.2°C.
